title: pH and major species for 0.5 M HCHO2 given Ka

content.question:
HCHO2(aq) + H2O(l) ⇄ H3O+(aq) + CHO2-(aq)

HCHO2(aq), a weak acid (Ka = 2 ×10-4), dissociates in water according to the equation above. Which of the following provides the best estimate of the pH of 0.5 M HCHO2(aq) and identifies the species at the highest concentration (excluding H2O) in the solution?

choices.label:
pH     
 Species at

Highest Concentration

1
 H3O+(aq)

pH

Highest Concentration

1
 HCHO2(aq)

pH

Highest Concentration

 H3O+(aq)

Highest Concentration

2
 HCHO2(aq)

content.answer:
pH     
 Species at

Highest Concentration

2
 HCHO2(aq)

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
